suncertify.server

Class BrokerRMIServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • suncertify.server.BrokerServer
      • suncertify.server.BrokerRMIServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.rmi.Remote, BrokerRMIServerIF, BrokerServerIF

    public class BrokerRMIServer
extends BrokerServer
implements BrokerRMIServerIF
    The BrokerRMIServer class is a singleton which servers as the application server when the application is run in server mode. It extends the BrokerServer class and implements the BrokerRMIServerIF.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Augustine Ogundimu
    See Also:
    BrokerRMIServerIF, BrokerServer

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        static BrokerServer getInstance()
        This method provides access to the single instance of this class as part of the singleton pattern implementation.
        Returns:
        The reference to the only instance of this object.

      • startServer

        public void startServer()
                 throws BrokerServerException
        This method executes the RMI server startup process. The steps include the following:
        • It retrieves the server configuration parameters from the application configuration file. This includes the RMI server name and port number.
        • It creates an RMI registry at the port specified in the application configuration file.
        • It exports the single instance on of this class to the RMI runtime to enable to receive remote calls.
        • It binds the server to the RMI registry.
        • It creates an instance of the data access object.
        • It registers an instance of the ServerCleanup thread with the java runtime as shutdown hook.
        Specified by:
        startServer in class BrokerServer
        Throws:
        BrokerServerException - is thrown if an error is encountered during startup process.

      • stopServer

        public void stopServer()
                throws BrokerServerException
        This method performs the process of suspending the RMI server if the server is up and running. The process involves a couple of steps.
        • It unbinds itself from the RMI registry.
        • It unexport itself from the RMI runtime thus disabling the receipt of remote calls.
        Specified by:
        stopServer in class BrokerServer
        Throws:
        BrokerServerException - is thrown if an error is encountered during the server shutdown process.
